title: The investment trusts that will pay you £75k over the next decade – on an initial sum of just £100k
text:
Finding investments that consistently pay income is a struggle given the state of interest rates and poor yields on some investments. However, a portfolio of investment trusts with a good yield and high dividend growth could set you up for your retirement.

Many investors make decisions on income investments based entirely on its yield – which is the dividend divided by the share price – but this can be misleading.

High yields tempt investors in it could high even if income is low, as the price could be very low. The opposite is also true, income investors tend to avoid lower-yielding investments, but these could provide high dividends but just have higher share prices.
